tool_calls.name: save_context

arguments.title: Switched from polling to WebSockets for real-time notifications
arguments.content:
We've decided to implement WebSockets instead of polling for our real-time notification feature. This change addresses the tradeoffs we considered:

1) **Latency**: Polling introduces unnecessary delays and resource consumption, while WebSockets maintain persistent connections that reduce latency.
2) **Scalability**: WebSockets scale better with more users since they avoid the overhead of frequent HTTP requests.
3) **Resource Usage**: Polling consumes server resources continuously, whereas WebSockets only use bandwidth when needed.
4) **Complexity**: While WebSockets add implementation complexity, this is outweighed by the performance and scalability benefits for our notification system.

tool_calls.mcp_result: {"atom_id":"a3fc7e52-7c59-4e69-bacb-28a7fdf0d58c"}
